001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Regime;
009
010/**
011 * A {@link Regime} decorator that performs training using <em>mini-batches</em>.
012 *
013 * <p>This regime splits the {@link DataSet} into smaller contiguous subsets
014 * (mini-batches) of a configurable size. It then delegates training to the
015 * wrapped regime once per mini-batch. This provides a compromise between
016 * full-batch training (using the entire dataset at once) and online (stochastic)
017 * training (using a single sample at a time).</p>
018 *
019 * <h3>Behavior</h3>
020 * <ul>
021 *   <li>The dataset is divided into sequential chunks of size
022 *   {@link #getSamplesPerLearning()}.</li>
023 *   <li>For each chunk, the delegate {@link Regime} is invoked with that subset.</li>
024 *   <li>If the dataset size is not divisible by the batch size, the last
025 *   mini-batch will contain the remaining samples.</li>
026 * </ul>
027 *
028 * @see DelegatedRegime
029 */
030@Strategy(role = Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
031public final class MiniBatchRegime extends DelegatedRegime {
032
033    private int samplesPerLearning;
034
035    /**
036     * Creates a new mini-batch trainer with the given mini-batch size.
037     *
038     * @param samplesPerLearning the number of samples per mini-batch (must be > 0)
039     */
040    public MiniBatchRegime(int samplesPerLearning) {
041        this(null, samplesPerLearning);
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * Creates a new mini-batch trainer with the given mini-batch size.
046     *
047     * @param samplesPerLearning the number of samples per mini-batch (must be > 0)
048     */
049    public MiniBatchRegime(Regime regime, int samplesPerLearning) {
050        super(regime);
051        this.samplesPerLearning = samplesPerLearning;
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * Returns the configured number of samples per mini-batch.
056     *
057     * @return the mini-batch size
058     */
059    public int getSamplesPerLearning() {
060        return samplesPerLearning;
061    }
062
063    /**
064     * Sets the number of samples per mini-batch.
065     *
066     * @param samplesPerLearning the new mini-batch size (must be > 0)
067     */
068    public void setSamplesPerLearning(int samplesPerLearning) {
069        this.samplesPerLearning = samplesPerLearning;
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Trains the given estimation function by dividing the dataset into
074     * mini-batches and delegating training to the wrapped regime for each batch.
075     *
076     * @param estimationFunction the model to train
077     * @param trainingSet        the dataset to split into mini-batches
078     * @param objective          the objective (loss) function
079     * @param optimizer          the optimizer to apply updates
080     * @param <E>                the type of estimation function
081     */
082    @Override
083    public <E extends EstimationFunction> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective, Optimizer<? super E> optimizer) {
084        int offset = 0;
085        int trainingSetSize = trainingSet.samples().size();
086        do {
087            int newOffset = Math.min(trainingSetSize, offset + samplesPerLearning);
088            regime.train(estimationFunction, trainingSet.subset(offset, newOffset), objective, optimizer);
089            offset = newOffset;
090        } while (offset >= trainingSet.samples().size());
091    }
092}
